meanings.definition: A person or thing that opens something.
meanings.sent1: The openers of the store arrived early to unlock the doors.
meanings.sent2: I always misplace my bottle openers when I need them.
meanings.sent3: The key was the real opener to solving the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the opener to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The opener of the treasure chest revealed a dazzling surprise.

meanings.definition: A device used to open containers or bottles.
meanings.sent1: Can you pass me the openers for the cans, please?
meanings.sent2: The opener for the jar was stuck, making it hard to open.
meanings.sent3: The opener for the soda can made a funny noise when used.
meanings.sent4: The bottle opener was like a magic wand for the stubborn cap.
meanings.sent5: The can opener made quick work of the sealed tin.

meanings.definition: The first game or event in a series.
meanings.sent1: The baseball team won the opener of the tournament.
meanings.sent2: Fans eagerly awaited the opener of the concert series.
meanings.sent3: The opener of the play set the tone for the entire performance.
meanings.sent4: The opener of the chess match was a strategic move.
meanings.sent5: The opener of the movie had everyone on the edge of their seats.

meanings.definition: A statement or action that initiates a conversation or interaction.
meanings.sent1: His joke served as a great opener for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The compliment was a perfect opener for their conversation.
meanings.sent3: The awkward silence needed a good opener to break it.
meanings.sent4: Her question was an opener to a deep discussion.
meanings.sent5: The opener of the debate sparked a lively exchange of ideas.
